item.title: Ticket #45801 (Duplicate post publish action) created
item.dc:creator: bmettee4
item.description:
I'll try to keep this short. Action "publish_to_publish" is being called twice when updating a published post under some circumstances. Web server registers two calls (one to index.php, one to /wp-admin/post.php). First call appears to update the content and non-meta data. Second call updates data from meta blocks.

Specifics: Any theme or plugin that adds meta data to a post forces a second call to the update process with the meta block data.

Problem: Any plugin that performs actions based on "publish_to_publish" is being called twice. In my specific instance the Better Notifications for WordPress plugin sends notifications mails doubled.

Wordpress version: 5.0.2
Theme: Customify, no plugins
Or
Theme: TwentyNineteen, and Plugin: Profile Builder

Basically anything that adds meta-data to a post object causes a second, duplicate, action.

If meta-data updates should trigger a second action, how can a plugin detect that there has been an additional call?

item.title: Ticket #45799 (Add an optional default parameter for WP_REST_Request::get_param method) updated
item.dc:creator: TimothyBlynJacobs
item.description:
Skip it in what sense? The server/request will apply the default automatically.

In what instances do you know the proper default value for a param, but not in the position to notate that default in the schema.

item.title: Ticket #45800 (Add short circuits for WP_Comment_Query) created
item.dc:creator: spacedmonkey
item.description: Now that WP_Query and WP_User_Query have filters to short circuit results in from a different source. WP_Comment_Query should have some ability to do the same.

item.dc:creator: laurelfulford
item.description:
Since release, Twenty Nineteen has also had updates to the following files that can have their versions bumped, to make sure they're not cached:

  • priority-menu.js
  • touch-keyboard-navigation.js
  • style-editor-customizer.css
  • customize-preview.js
  • customize-controls.js

Twenty Nineteen: Update theme description and tags.

Props jobthomas, kjellr.
Fixes #45693.

item.title: Ticket #44889 (Hide child theme creation message when we use child theme) updated
item.dc:creator: mukesh27
item.description:
Hi @audrasjb

When we use any child theme then also system show below message that tell user to use child theme instead of do changes in parent theme.

You appear to be making direct edits to your theme in the WordPress dashboard. We recommend that you don’t! Editing your theme directly could break your site and your changes may be lost in future updates. If you need to tweak more than your theme’s CSS, you might want to try <a href="%s">making a child theme</a>.

In 44889.2.patch patch i just remove child theme reference if you have any proper text for child theme then please suggest so i can update patch for this ticket or i can update patch with below description.

You appear to be making direct edits to your theme in the WordPress dashboard. We recommend that you don’t! Editing your theme directly could break your site.

item.title: Ticket #39338 (class-wp-hook.php - apply_filters() infinite loop) updated
item.dc:creator: pinchies
item.description:
I have the same error on my personal blog. On my log, it looks like it only started in October.

  • WordPress 4.9.8
  • PHP 5.3

[08-Oct-2018 03:40:32 UTC] PHP Warning: array_keys() expects parameter 1 to be array, integer given in /home/*/public_html/wp-includes/class-wp-hook.php on line 271

[08-Oct-2018 03:40:32 UTC] PHP Warning: current() expects parameter 1 to be array, null given in /home/*/public_html/wp-includes/class-wp-hook.php on line 275

[08-Oct-2018 03:40:32 UTC] PHP Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in /home/*/public_html/wp-includes/class-wp-hook.php on line 277

(home directory masked for privacy)

Error file was 788MB, but hey, who's counting? It only took my website completely offline after the disk filled up, nothing serious. 😑

Fortunately, its only a blog and not a mission critical website. I'm happy to provide a zip or even temporary login details to anyone who wants to have a poke if that might help things be diagnosed more rapidly. You can contact me at my username at google's email service dot company.

item.title: Ticket #42669 (Filter for terms list in admin tables) updated
item.dc:creator: audrasjb
item.description:
Milestone changed

Hello,

5.0.3 is going to be released in a couple of weeks. We are currently sorting the remaining tickets in the milestone.

The ticket adds a new filter and still needs a dev-feedback/second-opinion. Since 5.0.3 is going to be a "normal" minor with only self-contained patches and regression/bug fixes. Let's address this ticket in 5.1 which is scheduled for February.

item.title: Ticket #45798 (In Gutenberg, Contributor role can Publish articles) updated
item.dc:creator: RMarks
item.description:
Hello @rexxertt, welcome to WordPress Trac and thank you for your ticket :-)

I've tried to reproduce this using two different environments running WordPress 5.0.2. In both scenarios, after creating a new post with the Block Editor, I'm able to click Publish which changes to Submit for Review. After clicking Submit for Review, the post status changes to Pending. As a user with Contributor access, I'm unable to find a way to publish the post.

Could you please provide the steps your Contributor writers used to publish a post?

Thank you,
Ryan

item.title: Ticket #45793 (Month name is incorrectly abbreviated for English (UK) locale) updated
item.dc:creator: reddalek
item.description:
Hi @RMarks,

"I'm curious, as you manually change the Custom date field, does the preview show the issue before you press Save Changes at the bottom?"

Yes.

However, I just noticed that the issue didn't appear on another Wordpress installation I manage, so I just used the 'Re-install Now' option on the Updates page and that has magically fixed the issue.

I'm sorry for taking up your time...!

Please advise

item.title: 45797.diff attached to Ticket #45797
item.dc:creator: peterwilsoncc

item.title: Ticket #45797 (Add function for getting "ready" cron jobs with preflight filter for ...) created
item.dc:creator: peterwilsoncc
item.description:
Add the function wp_get_ready_cron_jobs() to return jobs ready to be run (with a timestamp in the past) with a preflight filter to allow plugins to use a custom cron storage mechanism.

This is to round out the functionality of #32656 to allow custom cron storage while making use of Core's system for spawning jobs.

item.title: Ticket #45796 (Twenty Nineteen: Mobile menu needs improvement for navigating on ...) created
item.dc:creator: laurelfulford
item.description:
Copied over from ​https://github.com/WordPress/twentynineteen/issues/723#issuecomment-450173083 (hattip @afercia):

When the "more" menu is expanded on a touchscreen device, there are several hidden tab stops that cause issues when navigating the site via keyboard. These are:

  • hidden sub-menu items are still focusable
  • all the links in the page are still focusable

When the menu is open it's still possible to tab away from the menu and navigate with the keyboard through all the focusable elements in the page.

If the intent is to show a full-screen menu, the menu should behave like a modal and tabbing should be constrained within the modal.

item.title: Ticket #45795 (Twenty Nineteen: missing license information for assets) updated
item.dc:creator: williampatton
item.description:
I was about to post a ticket for this very same issue. Since this one already exists I am posting my questions here.

What icons are used in the theme and what is their licence? Are they all material.io icons from Google used under Apache Licence 2.0?

Could we have that documented in the readme file for the theme? I see that is used to be noted there but was removed very early in the dev cycle for the theme at github.

Also note that for other themes distributed on .org repository we require that theme authors include a note or licence statement about all the applicable resources they use so that any derivatives of the themes are aware in advance of the licences they are bound by when using any given bundled resource.

item.title: Ticket #45795 (Twenty Nineteen: missing license information for assets) created
item.dc:creator: poena
item.description:
The themes readme.txt file is missing license and copyright information
for the bundled svg icons.

In twentynineteen\classes\class-twentynineteen-svg-icons.php we can find references like:

'link' => /* material-design – link */ '

But there is no other information about where the icons are from,

The theme needs to be 100% compatible with GPL, and it needs to include the license and copyright information for all assets.
If there are other assets included that are missing this information, that needs to be added as well.

item.title: Ticket #45794 (px/rem order reversed in Twenty Twelve blocks.css) created
item.dc:creator: superpoincare
item.description:
In the new blocks.css file for Twenty Twelve, px overrides rem in 2 styles, when it should be reversed:

​https://github.com/WordPress/WordPress/blob/master/wp-content/themes/twentytwelve/css/blocks.css#L100-L109

.wp-block-quote:not(.is-large):not(.is-style-large) {
	border: 0;
	padding: 1.714285714rem;
	padding: 24px;
}
.wp-block-quote {
	padding: 1.714285714rem;
	padding: 24px;
}

item.dc:creator: reddalek

Thanks for taking a look @RMarks!

I'm attaching three screenshots. You can see the month abbreviation used in the 'UK' setting, the full month for the 'US' setting, and (very weirdly) a mixture of the abbreviated and full month for the UK if I use a double F code. Let me know if there's more information which would be helpful.

item.title: Ticket #45793 (Month name is incorrectly abbreviated for English (UK) locale) created
item.dc:creator: reddalek
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

  1. Set the Site Language to 'English (UK)'
  2. Set the Date Format to 'jS F Y'

Expected result: 30th December 2018
Actual result: 30th Dec 2018

This is not observed if Site Language is 'English (United States)' where the 'F' will correctly print the full month name.
